text: hello everyone in this video I'll talk
about AWS backup search and item level
recovery followed by a demo my name is z
PV and I'm a technical C manager at
AWS this AWS backup feature will help
you search and recover items from Amazon
EBS snapshots and Amazon S3 backups it
allows users to search through metadata
of their backups and recover individual
items without restoring an entire backup
allowing for more efficient recoveries
AWS backup provides you an option to
create an index of all or a select
number of your Amazon EBS and Amazon
history backups this index stores and
cataloges all the metadata for a backup
allowing you to search for items using
properties such as creation time item
size file path object key and version ID
to only restore what you need you can
also create the index sign and searches
programmatically with AWS CLI or AWS
backup API via backup plan the search
capability aims to streamline the
process of locating and recovering
specific files or objects across
multiple EBS or S3 backups potentially
reducing recovery cost and time and
helping organizations with faster RTO
during a data loss
event this ews backup feature can help
you find files or objects created within
specific date ranges aiding in
compliance checks and audits you can
recover specific files or objects out
after accidental deletions or Ransom
attacks you can recover items to scan
for vulnerability or restore everything
except the infected item or
items you can test and confirm your
Disaster Recovery Readiness by quickly
verifying the presence and integrity of
critical files and objects across
multiple
backups it also provides opportunity to
selectively restore development and
testing related files or objects without
restoring entire production
backups here's a sample workflow for
search and item LEL recovery
process first you index your backup
either by editing existing backup plans
or when you create on demand backup AWS
backup supports index creation for EBS
and S3 backups at the time of this
recording next after the completion of
your indexing you create a search for
your resource type with the required
backup properties and item properties s
and EBS have different item properties
that you can create your searches with
once your search is complete you can
review the search results on the console
from here you can export search results
to an history bucket for a longer
retention by default your search results
will be available on the console for 7
days after you are done reviewing search
results you can restore your selected
files or objects to an history bucket in
your AWS
account AWS backup search and item
recovery pricing is based on number of
objects or files scanned in your backup
you are built for the backups that are
indexed at the time of the indexing the
storage of the backup index and for
searching your backups restorage will be
built based on resource type per adws
backup restore pricing you will pay for
only what you use with n minimums or
upfront commitments please see AWS backa
pricing page for detailed
